Koraput district of Odisha and Bastar district of Chhattisgarh will be benefited through this project.
CCEA approved doubling of Jagdalpur-Koraput section railway line of 110.22 km with a completion cost of Rs.1839.02 crore.
Koraput district of Odisha, Vizianagaram and Vishakaphatnam districts of Andhra Pradesh will be benefited through this project.
The project is likely to be completed in the next seven years during 12th and 13th Plan period.
Doubling of this line will greatly ease the ever increasing freight traffic between these sections thereby increasing revenue of Railways.
Cabinet approved doubling of Kottavalasa-Koraput Railway line of 189.278 km with a completion cost of Rs.2977.64 crore.
Cabinet approved providing relief to the militancy affected migrants of the hilly areas of Jammu division at par with the Kashmiri Migrants.
The new proposal includes construction of transit accommodations Kashmir Valley for Kashmiri migrants to whom jobs have/will be provided.
New proposal provides for additional 3000 state government jobs to Kashmiri migrants with financial assistance from the Government of India.
The total expenditure involved in this proposal for Kashmiri migrants is Rs. 2000 crore.
Cabinet has given approval for providing State Govt jobs & transit accommodations in Kashmir Valley for rehabilitation of Kashmiri migrants.
The institution will be the first of its kind for quality laboratory animals for basic and applied biomedical research in the country.
The estimated project cost is Rs. 338.58 crores and the resource center is expected to be functional by 2018-19.
Cabinet approved the setting up of a National Resource Facility for Bio-medical Research (NARF) at Genome Valley in Hyderabad.

The manuscript has over 80 fine miniature illustrations. It is a part of Volume 1 of the work and no other copy of it is known to exist.
The king’s wazir Rasheeduddin Fazlullah Hamedani wrote it in Persian and chronicled the history up to the reign of Oljeitju (1304-1316).
Called Jamiut Tawarikh, this work was one of the grandest projects undertaken by the Ilkhanate king Ghazan Khan.
